    • Method Detail

      • scheduleOneSecondTimer

        public static org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitTask scheduleOneSecondTimer(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin host,
                                                     java.lang.Runnable task,
                                                     boolean async)
        Schedules a task to execute every second, starting one second after the call to this method.
        Parameters:
        host - The plugin under which to schedule this task. This parameter may not be null.
        task - The task to execute on the main server thread after one server tick. It must not be null.
        async - Whether to run this task asynchronously. If this is true, the task will be executed on a separate thread from the main server thread. Asynchronous tasks should never access any Bukkit API other than the scheduler, which can be used to schedule a synchronous task. Synchronous tasks block the main server thread, but have the liberty of full Bukkit API access.
        Returns:
        The scheduled task as returned by the bukkit scheduler.
        See Also:
        BukkitScheduler.runTaskTimer(Plugin, Runnable, long, long), BukkitScheduler.runTaskTimerAsynchronously(Plugin, Runnable, long, long)

      • runAfterTeleport

        public static <T> boolean runAfterTeleport(@Nullable
                           QueuedTeleport<T> teleport,
                           @Nonnull
                           java.lang.Runnable... tasks)
        Run the specified tasks after the completion of the specified teleport.

        This method is intended to wrap calls to TeleportationManager methods which may return a null QueuedTeleport. If the method returns null and that value is passed into this method, the tasks will run instantly after the teleport, as was intended, without an additional null check in client code.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the destination of the teleport.
        Parameters:
        teleport - The teleport to scedule tasks for. If this is null or cancelled, the tasks will be run instantly.
        tasks - The tasks to run.
        Returns:
        Whether the tasks were queued. The return value will be false if they ran instantly during the execution of this method and true if they were queued for execution and consequently have not yet run.
        See Also:
        TeleportationManager.teleportPlayer(Player player, Location targetLoc), QueuedTeleport.registerOnTeleport(Runnable)
